trans-unit.source: Get notified by alerts | Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Get notified by alerts | Microsoft Intune

trans-unit.source: Learn how alerts keep you in touch with what's happening in Microsoft Intune.
trans-unit.target: Learn how alerts keep you in touch with what's happening in Microsoft Intune.

trans-unit.source: Get notified by Microsoft Intune alerts
trans-unit.target: Get notified by Microsoft Intune alerts

trans-unit.source: Alerts keep you in touch with what's happening in Microsoft Intune.
trans-unit.target: Alerts keep you in touch with what's happening in Microsoft Intune.

trans-unit.source: For example, alerts can notify you about the following events:
trans-unit.target: For example, alerts can notify you about the following events:

trans-unit.source: A problem with the Exchange Connector which affects mobile device management
trans-unit.target: A problem with the Exchange Connector which affects mobile device management

trans-unit.source: Malware was found on a computer
trans-unit.target: Malware was found on a computer

trans-unit.source: A conflict between two Intune policies was detected
trans-unit.target: A conflict between two Intune policies was detected

trans-unit.source: How alerts work
trans-unit.target: How alerts work

trans-unit.source: Alerts are generated based on **alert types**, a set of preconfigured rules built into Intune.
trans-unit.target: Alerts are generated based on **alert types**, a set of preconfigured rules built into Intune.

trans-unit.source: For example, the alert type, **Cloud storage has 10% or less free space**, alerts you when you are running out of space to store your apps in the cloud.
trans-unit.target: For example, the alert type, **Cloud storage has 10% or less free space**, alerts you when you are running out of space to store your apps in the cloud.

trans-unit.source: You can enable or disable alert types and configure properties for each alert type.
trans-unit.target: You can enable or disable alert types and configure properties for each alert type.

trans-unit.source: For example, using the above alert type, you can configure:
trans-unit.target: For example, using the above alert type, you can configure:

trans-unit.source: **State:** Whether this alert type is enabled or disabled
trans-unit.target: **State:** Whether this alert type is enabled or disabled

trans-unit.source: **Severity:** How serious is this alert?
trans-unit.target: **Severity:** How serious is this alert?

trans-unit.source: Severity
trans-unit.target: Severity

trans-unit.source: Details
trans-unit.target: Details

trans-unit.source: Critical alert
trans-unit.target: Critical alert

trans-unit.source: Indicates a serious issue that you should investigate as soon as possible, for example, if malware was detected on a computer.
trans-unit.target: Indicates a serious issue that you should investigate as soon as possible, for example, if malware was detected on a computer.

trans-unit.source: Warning alert
trans-unit.target: Warning alert

trans-unit.source: Indicates an issue that isn't currently serious but might become serious if you don't attend to it, for example, security updates are waiting to be installed.
trans-unit.target: Indicates an issue that isn't currently serious but might become serious if you don't attend to it, for example, security updates are waiting to be installed.

trans-unit.source: Informational alert
trans-unit.target: Informational alert

trans-unit.source: Indicates information that isn't critical to your operations, for example, a new version of the Exchange Connector is available.
trans-unit.target: Indicates information that isn't critical to your operations, for example, a new version of the Exchange Connector is available.

trans-unit.source: Other alert types might have different items that you can configure, like the percentage of devices that must be affected by an issue before an alert is generated.
trans-unit.target: Other alert types might have different items that you can configure, like the percentage of devices that must be affected by an issue before an alert is generated.

trans-unit.source: When the criteria in an alert type is met, an alert is generated and shown in the Intune admin console.
trans-unit.target: When the criteria in an alert type is met, an alert is generated and shown in the Intune admin console.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you can configure Intune to notify you by email when an alert is generated.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you can configure Intune to notify you by email when an alert is generated.

trans-unit.source: Set up alerts
trans-unit.target: Set up alerts

trans-unit.source: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Admin** > **Alerts and Notifications**, and then choose one of the following tasks:
trans-unit.target: In the [Microsoft Intune administration console](https://manage.microsoft.com), choose **Admin** > **Alerts and Notifications**, and then choose one of the following tasks:

trans-unit.source: Task
trans-unit.target: Task

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Alert Types
trans-unit.target: Alert Types

trans-unit.source: Choose the alert type that you want to configure, and then do one of the following:
trans-unit.target: Choose the alert type that you want to configure, and then do one of the following:

trans-unit.source: Choose **Configure**.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Configure**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Configure Alert Type** dialog box, configure the settings that you want, and then choose **OK**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Configure Alert Type** dialog box, configure the settings that you want, and then choose **OK**.

trans-unit.source: **Enable** or **Disable** the alert.
trans-unit.target: **Enable** or **Disable** the alert.

trans-unit.source: Expand the **Alert Types** node, and choose a category to view only the alert types in that category.
trans-unit.target: Expand the **Alert Types** node, and choose a category to view only the alert types in that category.

trans-unit.source: Recipients
trans-unit.target: Recipients

trans-unit.source: Choose **Add** to add a new email address that will receive the email notifications that you set up.
trans-unit.target: Choose **Add** to add a new email address that will receive the email notifications that you set up.

trans-unit.source: You can also **Edit** or **Delete** existing recipients.
trans-unit.target: You can also **Edit** or **Delete** existing recipients.

trans-unit.source: To receive notifications, you must also add this email address as a recipient under **Notification Rules**.
trans-unit.target: To receive notifications, you must also add this email address as a recipient under **Notification Rules**.

trans-unit.source: Notification Rules
trans-unit.target: Notification Rules

trans-unit.source: Configures rules that define who an email alert will be sent to.
trans-unit.target: Configures rules that define who an email alert will be sent to.

trans-unit.source: You can either:
trans-unit.target: You can either:

trans-unit.source: **Choose an existing rule** - Choose a rule, and then choose **Select Recipients**.
trans-unit.target: **Choose an existing rule** - Choose a rule, and then choose **Select Recipients**.

trans-unit.source: You can then select all recipients who will receive an email when an alert that fulfills this rule is generated.
trans-unit.target: You can then select all recipients who will receive an email when an alert that fulfills this rule is generated.

trans-unit.source: **Create a new rule** - enter a name for the rule, select the alert categories and alert severity that apply to the rules, select the device groups that the rule applies to, and select the users who will receive an email when an alert is generated.
trans-unit.target: **Create a new rule** - enter a name for the rule, select the alert categories and alert severity that apply to the rules, select the device groups that the rule applies to, and select the users who will receive an email when an alert is generated.

trans-unit.source: You can also **Enable**, **Disable**, **Edit**, or **Delete** an existing rule.
trans-unit.target: You can also **Enable**, **Disable**, **Edit**, or **Delete** an existing rule.

trans-unit.source: Working with alerts
trans-unit.target: Working with alerts

trans-unit.source: Use the following options to help you work with alerts from the Intune admin console.
trans-unit.target: Use the following options to help you work with alerts from the Intune admin console.

trans-unit.source: Option
trans-unit.target: Option

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: View active alerts
trans-unit.target: View active alerts

trans-unit.source: Choose one of:
trans-unit.target: Choose one of:

trans-unit.source: **View an alert summary** - In the **Dashboard** workspace, the top errors are shown in the Alerts pane.
trans-unit.target: **View an alert summary** - In the **Dashboard** workspace, the top errors are shown in the Alerts pane.

trans-unit.source: Choose the pane to see more detailed information.
trans-unit.target: Choose the pane to see more detailed information.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, you can view an alert summary on the **Overview** page of the **Alerts** workspace.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, you can view an alert summary on the **Overview** page of the **Alerts** workspace.

trans-unit.source: **View all alerts** - In the **Alerts** workspace, choose **All Alerts**.
trans-unit.target: **View all alerts** - In the **Alerts** workspace, choose **All Alerts**.

trans-unit.source: View notices
trans-unit.target: View notices

trans-unit.source: Choose one of:
trans-unit.target: Choose one of:

trans-unit.source: In the **Dashboard** workspace, choose **Notices**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Dashboard** workspace, choose **Notices**.

trans-unit.source: In the **Alerts** workspace, choose **All Alerts** > **Notices**.
trans-unit.target: In the **Alerts** workspace, choose **All Alerts** > **Notices**.

trans-unit.source: Close an alert
trans-unit.target: Close an alert

trans-unit.source: In the list of alerts, choose the alert to close, and then choose **Close Alert**.
trans-unit.target: In the list of alerts, choose the alert to close, and then choose **Close Alert**.

trans-unit.source: Closed alerts are permanently deleted after 90 days.
trans-unit.target: Closed alerts are permanently deleted after 90 days.

trans-unit.source: Reactivate a closed alert
trans-unit.target: Reactivate a closed alert

trans-unit.source: In the list of alerts, set the **Filters** drop-down to **Closed**.
trans-unit.target: In the list of alerts, set the **Filters** drop-down to **Closed**.

trans-unit.source: In the list of closed alerts, select the alert that you want to reactivate, and then choose **Reactivate Alert**.
trans-unit.target: In the list of closed alerts, select the alert that you want to reactivate, and then choose **Reactivate Alert**.

trans-unit.source: Intune alerts remain active until:
trans-unit.target: Intune alerts remain active until:

trans-unit.source: The issue that caused the alert is fixed
trans-unit.target: The issue that caused the alert is fixed

trans-unit.source: You manually close the alert
trans-unit.target: You manually close the alert

trans-unit.source: 45 days have passed since the alert was generated
trans-unit.target: 45 days have passed since the alert was generated

trans-unit.source: If the same alert is generated by devices that run different operating systems, you might see multiple versions of the same alert in the alerts list.
trans-unit.target: If the same alert is generated by devices that run different operating systems, you might see multiple versions of the same alert in the alerts list.

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: Monitoring and reports with Microsoft Intune
trans-unit.target: Monitoring and reports with Microsoft Intune
